name: Replicating death
description: using snoop and Janus to make life miserable :)

name: fark yo rig - Jinteki tempo warfare
description:
Rather than playing an iceless shell game, this sets up a handful of servers with cheap ETR ice and rig destroying sentries.

With net damage and programs being trashed, use the loss of runner's tempo to score out agendas, inflicting more net damage, slowing their tempo more.

Early econ relies on Profiteering, so try to score one ASAP. The 1pt agendas also enable Archer, making your servers costly to break into. Watch out for Faeries, they will make it easy to blow through the sentries early on until they get their rig established. Use single- or double- advanced Secretaries to snipe out important programs (ninja, corroder, mimic or crypsis) once they have a sentry breaker up.

name: Parasite Workshop
description:
Limited to one core set. Tips and advice always welcome.

You want wyldside and workshop early. Use djinn to tutor for datasucker, medium, or nerve agent.

name: Experimenting on Perfection
description: This identity is horrible. It's the equivalent of some card making runners spend two clicks to run on remotes, which is interesting, but who runs on Jinteki remotes? Most often R&D lock is what you'll be facing, so it doesn't help a whole lot it seems. But that wont stop me from trying. This deck tries to make the most use of remotes and make central servers painful. The idea is to use Trick of Light to advance agendas, making dead traps useful. Shipment allows you to install three remotes and advance one, either a trap or ambush, in one turn.

name: NEXT: Director's Cut 1.3
description: Based on the deck found here: http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1079213/next-design-analysis-of-its-mechanics-on-a-sampl The idea is to score ABT in turn 2. And then, shock, actually use it. After trying to get more money, repeat it. It's not the most consistent thing. This is tweaked to get some more money.

name: Run Reina run!
description: Getting ready for a store tournament. All the usual anarch toys with influence focused on card draw to speed up rig setup.

name: Might Makes Right 1.1
description: This deck is designed to destroy the runner either through brain or net damage and trashing resources and programs. Also the plus one strength ice should on average cost the runner one or two extra credits a turn.

name: Brain Drain 2.0
description:
This version tries to address the issues I found with the first, namely no early Econ and too many components in the full rig. Added dirty laundry and Kati to get Econ going earlier, no more personal workshop, console, or mem chip, Escher is in to keep a player from making a 3 sentry server which is bad for cloak and dagger. Also added account siphon, because I think it may be worth it, even if I have to play snowball and 3 nach instead of corroder and decoy.

After a few games, this feels much better than the first version. You can get rolling applying pressure earlier, and then add to your rig as you need to. Power shutdown sniping cloaks is a big problem and the rig is a bit fragile, so you need to be cautious and protect it, I think I will get clone chip in here in the next iteration. Similarly, troubleshooter can be big trouble with dagger. No expose and no sot are also pieces that would be really nice to have, but not sure how to fit in yet.

I first had two Gordianblade but dropped one for a crypsis, because I got totally locked out by a single chimera in a game against a twiy rush deck.
